title: Why is Lane Stealing Never Punished
body:
I have encountered the  same guy about 3 times. He always get support and then auto locks in adc saying "go support or I will throw". This has been over the span of a couple days, each time with me reporting him for stealing lanes and yet nothing happens to him.
Oh but yea, if you say a *NAUGHTY* word you get insta banned. Get your shit together please riot.

replies.body: Just block people like that and they won't be in anymore of your games. Blocking them whitelists them so you can't have them in any matches in the future

> [{quoted}](name=epic style bro,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=uFjWLhMV,comment-id=0003,timestamp=2018-10-19T15:45:39.844+0000)
>
> Just block people like that and they won't be in anymore of your games. Blocking them whitelists them so you can't have them in any matches in the future

Wrong.
Completely utterly wrong.
Blocking does nothing for matchmaking.

> [{quoted}](name=epic style bro,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=uFjWLhMV,comment-id=0003,timestamp=2018-10-19T15:45:39.844+0000)
>
> Just block people like that and they won't be in anymore of your games. Blocking them whitelists them so you can't have them in any matches in the future

That is incorrect. Riot has mentioned several times that they will never make it possible to keep people from being in your games to avoid abuse.

> [{quoted}](name=epic style bro,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=uFjWLhMV,comment-id=0003,timestamp=2018-10-19T15:45:39.844+0000)
>
> Just block people like that and they won't be in anymore of your games. Blocking them whitelists them so you can't have them in any matches in the future

This is false information

Call his bluff, make him dodge. 

Giving him your role just looks like you traded positions with him.
You don't actually own the lane. Anyone can go to any lane. Literally.

It's weird how when you go into a game it says what role you have been designated to play. 

Almost like the game is GIVING YOU SPECIFICALLY THAT ROLE
You can't get banned for picking draven support, for example, but saying "go support or I'll throw" is something you can report for.

You can get banned for picking Draven support and not talking it through with your team as you go and "troll" them. Look at what happened with the Singed support player, or the Ivern support. Or the Nunu.
No, you cannot. Those players got their bans overturned.
They were also told they would remain unbanned if they properly communicated how their strategy can win to their team.

> [{quoted}](name=Sp33d Zer0,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=uFjWLhMV,comment-id=0006000200000000,timestamp=2018-10-20T08:39:19.601+0000)
>
> You can get banned for picking Draven support and not talking it through with your team as you go and "troll" them. Look at what happened with the Singed support player, or the Ivern support. Or the Nunu.

er singed support/jg was unbanned btw, however he was playing for the win - i also like leaving my adc a bit earlier than i should and play as a second jungler, kind of. In the pro games the broadcasters call it laneswap... still, if he is playing as a straight carry (draven supp. xd), it is unfair yet quite probably... nothing will happen. And this is bad.

i am not sure what happened back then though.. was he on reddit, or he got _really_ too many reports? Or there was something wrong with his winrate (too high prob)?.. and, i think he was manually banned... though am not sure.

While this is kind of true, doing so with the intent to grief, especially with the statement "go support or ill throw", is definitely against the rules.

If you think double mid can work, have at it. If you say "im mid or else", youre not gunna have a fun time.

>While this is kind of true, doing so with the intent to grief, especially with the statement "go support or ill throw", is definitely against the rules.
If you think double mid can work, have at it. If you say "im mid or else", youre not gunna have a fun time.

You are sabotaging your team by forcing them to play in a way they aren't comfortable with.

Not a reason to ban. Riot revoked those bans and apologized. Your teams playstyle means nothing, its your pick, not theirs. All that matters is intent (and usually its not going to be someone wanting to double mid anyway, so its not really an issue)

>Not a reason to ban. Riot revoked those bans and apologized. 

As far as I am aware Riot didn't actually revoke those bans, they just served their 14 days and haven't gotten banned since.

>Your teams playstyle means nothing, its your pick, not theirs. All that matters is intent (and usually its not going to be someone wanting to double mid anyway, so its not really an issue)

If your playstyle is directly interfering with your teams ability to do their, that sounds like sabotage to me.

They were revoked, but they already served their punishments by that time, so the punishments were lifted from their account history.

By that logic, if i first pick yasuo and you dont pick a knockup champ, youre sabotaging the team.

> By that logic, if i first pick yasuo and you dont pick a knockup champ, youre sabotaging the team.

Sure, picking a champion that combos with him may be the most efficient choice, but Yasuo has a knock-up himself, so you aren't preventing him from doing his role by not bringing another one and if he for whatever reason can't knock them up himself he probably shouldn't be playing Yasuo.

But someone leaving you alone in a duo lane or turning their solo lane into a duo lane puts them into a position they aren't prepared for (and realistically shouldn't be expected to be prepared for due to the rarity of such playstyles), thus forcing them to heavily change their playstyle on the spot and negatively influencing their performance.

Sucks to be them? Either adapt or sucks to be you. Either way, if im support and my ADC goes full tyler 1, im supporting mid. No point giving bot more kills because my ADC cant stay alive for more than 3 seconds.

> Sucks to be them? Either adapt or sucks to be you.

I'd prefer 1 player stops reinforcing their bad habits to 4 players having to adapt to them.

>  Either way, if im support and my ADC goes full tyler 1, im supporting mid. No point giving bot more kills because my ADC cant stay alive for more than 3 seconds.

There is a difference between leaving lane because you knows it's lost and playing another position from the start of the game.
Not really, and people can do whatever they want as long as they arent flaming and intend to win.

Everyone can say they intend to win, even if they are obviously trolling. Punishments for griefing should be handed out based on how negatively your actions affect your team and ignorance shouldn't be an excuse.

Literally not how it works, nor should work. People have gotten to masters one tricking AD leblanc and support Katarina. There is no "oh but it negatively affects the team", thats just you admitting you cant play something or you think it cant work, not that it doesnt.

Hell, double jungle has been a top tier strat numerous times over the years, as well as duo top.

>Literally not how it works, nor should work. People have gotten to masters one tricking AD leblanc and support Katarina.

I have never heard of someone reaching Masters with Katarina support and I don't believe it happened since it sounds awful. AD LB at least has a niche so while the build may be less effective than her normal builds there are still merits to it.

>There is no "oh but it negatively affects the team", thats just you admitting you cant play something or you think it cant work, not that it doesnt.

A build/strategy that doesn't work anywhere close to consistently or interferes with your teammates ability to play isn't viable. I don't need to play 5000 support games with an utility-less and gold reliant champion to know it's bad.

>Hell, double jungle has been a top tier strat numerous times over the years, as well as duo top.

Yes, but the state of the game was different enough back then to make them VIABLE.

> Literally happened, multiple seasons, pre and post rework, ending either high diamond or masters

I couldn't find anything about it.

> Jungle Teemo is a thing up to diamond

Teemo Jungle is a fringe things with a small pick rate and a 43 % winrate. It's probably only played when a Teemo one trick gets autofilled and frankly doesn't seem very good.

> every ADC can be played mid, most can be played top

They can be and again this is a niche with some value, unlike other things.

> many jungle

Most ADC don't have very impressive early clears, have bad ganks and are probably dead if they ever met the enemy jungler in a 1v1.

> and most can support

Heavely gold reliant champions with little utility cannot support. They cannot function on a supports budget and don't bring anything else to make them worthwhile.

> Hell, mf support is viable in tournaments

MF Support was picked specifically to counter Zira. This was her niche and she would be a trollpick in any other situation.

> as is jungle ezreal

Jungle Ezreal appeared because buffs made him into a viable jungler.

Literally happened, multiple seasons, pre and post rework, ending either high diamond or masters. Jungle teemo is a thing up to diamond, every ADC can be played mid, most can be played top, many jungle, and most can support. Hell, mf support is viable in tournaments, as is jungle ezreal. You just need to get over yourself.

> [{quoted}](name=Pika Fox,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=uFjWLhMV,comment-id=00060001,timestamp=2018-10-19T18:40:15.808+0000)
>
> While this is kind of true, doing so with the intent to grief, especially with the statement "go support or ill throw", is definitely against the rules.
> 
> If you think double mid can work, have at it. If you say "im mid or else", youre not gunna have a fun time.

You understand. No surprise you get down votes.

It's sad though. They are mad at us for telling the truth. Despite Riot being the ones making the rules.

> [{quoted}](name=nobotninja,realm=EUNE,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=uFjWLhMV,comment-id=00060003,timestamp=2018-10-19T22:56:50.023+0000)
>
> Even if you are "autofilled", you are given a role at the lobby. While you can change, you are under no obligation to give up your given role - that is your role. Role-stealing is a thing in League, and is reportable.
> 
> Let's say, we play on the same server. Whatever your role is, I'm gonna always instalock something for it, and go to your lane instead of you, or even with you - you don't own the role, you don't own the lane. Are you gonna be content with that? I can kind of guess the answer.

You know the problem with your situation? Riot bans players, not me. No matter how irritated I get with the other person, Riot still has sole discretion. If Riot decides not to ban them, then I have to get over it or stop playing.

As a matter of fact.. _according to rito, it is bannable._

Else, since i get trolls EVERY SINGLE GAME i don't go supp (either pick troll supp/go adc/straight int though not admitting it/staying afk without zoning nor anything at all, in fact saying he's "eating"/picking every single kill so again the supp is me), i have begun making a list with screenshots of.. and in one beautiful day, i will send them to the supp, then publish their reaction.

Because i simply don't believe the IFS does anything on the matter. And i think, you don't either.

oh, and yes you can check my match history!

Get some screenshots of his threats in champ select, then use the replay feature to show how the player actually goes to whatever lane they want, then submit a Support Ticket with your screenshots/clips as evidence.
Let him throw. You'll lose one match sure, but he'll lose a match AND create evidence against himself.
Riot doesnt give a shit. As long as he isnt toxic nothing will ever happen to soft inters, lane stealers and boosted players.
Things like that are not difficult to code into ifs. Rito? Plz?

Would you like to propose a solution? It's almost impossible to solve this issue. You can't have a word ban that bans "throw" or "go" unless Riot literally watches everyone's chat, which will never happen and I hope it doesn't.

They do get banned. Its just easier and faster to ban for something chat related than gameplay related. 

If i give you a jar of 1,000,000 marbles of the same color, and ask you whether or not they are red, im sure you could respond to that question immediately.

If i give you the same jar and ask you if they all weigh the same, its going to take much longer.
The game gives you a role when you get into champ select, they only need to check if a role swap was agreed to in chat so it shouldn't take any longer than banning people for flaming.

Not really possible. The automated system doesnt know what you reported for other than the options, it cant easily figure that out, nor could it easily tell if a lane swap was agreed to or not through chat alone (you can communicate outside LoL)

The game knows what role players have been assigned and role stealing alone should be enough for an instant 14 day ban, so the other options shouldn't matter. 

People communicating outside of LoL are going to be premade 99 % of the time, so the system can simply exclude premades.
Sure, but it cant easily detect this. Youd just punish way too many people for no reason.
The game knows which role it gives you, who you are premade with and what you are typing, what exactly is hard to detect here and who would this punish for no reason.
Except you can communicate outside lol and not be premade.
Even that could be checked for in the chat logs.

No, discord vc cannot be checked for chat logs.

Neither can Skype.

Or video call.
That's true, I didn't think about it before, but this would create a lot of "he said, she said" cases, but this could be fixed by introducing a role swap feature.
You can Take a screen shot. There's a default hotkey for it. It should be the "print screen " button. Paste the pic to the paint.ms and send in a ticket along with the pic to support.

Just call his bluff. Lock in whatever the system says your role should be (not what he tried to force you into). Then lane as you normally would, last hitting minions and such. When he intentionally feeds, report him for inting.
its sad cuz the role stealing actually works....
Don't let them push you around

If you let him go to the lane instead of you (that is, taking the position they abandoned), it doesnt look like a flagged event.

That's right.

The only way to get people like these in trouble is to completely ignore them and in so doing, make your team lose the game.

However, taking screenshots of what they said before the game starts and turning that over to Riot through a Support Ticket, rather than the end-of-game report screen, will definitely help your case.
